content.description: Start matched on frowning slot, climb into sloping dishes to the right of the pod, climb pockets and slots to reach the weakness and top out over a precarious landing
content.protection: Several pads (tiered landing) try not to fall topping out as the bottom tier is an extra 6-8 feet further down at this point.
content.location: Far right (of the lines I'm willing to climb with the progressively worse landing). Start same as if you're climbing the pod (with the same first move) instead of climbing left into the pod, continue right along surprisingly smooth sloping rail. When the rail runs out, continue right through pockets and slots to reach a small weakness in the lip and top out.

content.description: Traverse the entire Moon Roof from left to right. Begin on underclings on far left side, work right and top out just past mini-cave.
content.location: Begin on underclings on far left side of Moon Roof area, work right and eventually top out just past mini-cave. Good social-distancing fun!

content.description: Start right hand pinch and left hand dish, climb directly out using distinct slots, use a decent two finger pocket to reach the lip and finish with a perfect cup-holder jug
content.location: Center of the roof between the chimney and the pod, look for several distinct slots in the roof. Starting with the right hand pinch and left hand dish should set you up to move immediately into the first slot.

content.description: Start left hand side pull pocket, climb into chimney sized weakness using slots and blobs
content.location: Just right of the OW feature (Europa), starts below and left of the chimney sized weakness and climbs into the weakness to top out

content.description: Start on low pockets, climb OW. Using the holds in and around the crack makes this climb pretty casual; a nice eliminate may be possible: climb using only OW technique (not sure how hard this will be).
content.location: Far left line on the roof. The climb starts below and left of the off-width crack and ascends using holds in and around the crack itself.

content.description: Start matched on the frowning slot, climb into the pod, escape the pod to top out
content.location: The start hold is directly below the huge pod. The first move takes you a bit right and away from the pod, but quickly cut back left to a few pockets and slots that help you gain access to the pod. From there, it's as much wrestling as it is climbing to defeat this beast and escape unscathed.

content.description: There is a roof just a ways past Monster roof that isn't described on MP or in the guide book by Zak and Jason (I'm not sure if it's in "Cheap Way to Fly"). The climbing on this roof is in no way unique; the style is pretty typical of Priest draw. If anything, this roof is more about climbing features instead of endless choices of pockets. If anyone has info on this roof, please feel free to contribute or let me know problem names and first ascents.
